FuncDef:
The ve-group command creates a VE-Group and binds a VE interface to the VE-Group.
The undo ve-group command restores the default configuration.
By default, a VE interface is not bound to a VE-Group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a VE-Group.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 8192.

Indicates that a VE interface is used as a Layer 2 VE interface to terminate a VLL.
-

Indicates that a VE interface is used as a Layer 3 VE interface to access an MPLS L3VPN service.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By creating a VE-Group, you can implement L2VPN termination and L3VPN access or implement L3VPN termination and BRAS access on the same device.
Precautions
A VE-Group contains only one l2-terminate VE interface and one l3-access VE interface in an L2VPN accessing L3VPN or L2VPN accessing BRAS scenario.
In an L3VPN accessing BRAS scenario, a VE-Group contains only one l3-access VE interface, and only Layer 3 user access can be configured on sub-interfaces of the l3-access VE interface.
An l2-terminate VE interface, an l3-terminate VE interface must have their own sub-interfaces created before implementing VLAN service access.
The VE interfaces in a VE-Group must both be board VE interfaces or Global-VE interfaces.
The two VE interfaces in a VE-Group must be on the same board.
An l3-access VE sub-interface can be configured as a QinQ VLAN tag termination sub-interface, dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interface, sub-interface bound to a VLAN and encapsulated with dot1q, or sub-interface with an 802.1p priority range specified.
An l2-terminate sub-interface can be configured as a sub-interface bound to a VLAN and encapsulated with dot1q, dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interface, QinQ stacking sub-interface, or QinQ mapping sub-interface.
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
